turns.content: I am created a vr game using unity and xr interaction toolkit, i want to make star wars battlefront 3 like it was going to be, was 99% done, i want to build the spritual successor, what steps do i need to take?

Creating a game like Star Wars Battlefront 3 is a challenging project, but with the right approach and resources, it is possible. Here are some steps you can take to help you achieve your goal:

1. Gather inspiration and research: You can start by playing Star Wars Battlefront 2 and other similar games to gain inspiration and ideas on how to design your game. Also, research different art styles, level designs, and sound effects to get a better understanding of what makes a great game.
2. Plan your game: Define the scope of your project, the features you want to include, and the target audience. Create a project plan, timelines, and a budget to ensure you stay on track and on budget.
3. Create game assets: Use software such as Maya, 3D Studio Max, or Blender to create your game assets such as characters, vehicles, and environments.
4. Use Unity and XR Interaction Toolkit: To create your game, you can use the Unity game engine and XR Interaction Toolkit to add interactive elements to your game.
5. Test and iterate: Test your game regularly to identify bugs, and use player feedback to make necessary improvements to the gameplay, levels, and overall experience.
6. Market and release: When your game is ready, create a marketing plan and release it to the public. You can use social media, game development communities, and video game websites to reach your target audience.
7. Maintain and update: After the release of your game, continue to maintain it by fixing bugs and adding new features to keep your players engaged.

Creating a game like Star Wars Battlefront 3 requires a lot of hard work and dedication, but with the right approach and resources, you can create a fantastic game that fans will love.
what are the main game components i will require to task out with my team?

To create a game like Star Wars Battlefront 3, you will need to task out several key components to your team. Here are some of the main components:

1. Game design: You will need a team of game designers who will be responsible for defining the game mechanics, rules, and objectives. They will also be responsible for creating the game's overall design and story.
2. 3D modeling and animation: You will need a team of 3D modelers and animators who will create the game's characters, vehicles, and environments. They will also create animations for the characters and vehicles.
3. Programming: You will need a team of programmers who will be responsible for creating the game's code and implementing the game mechanics. They will also ensure that the game runs smoothly and is free of bugs.
4. Sound design: You will need a team of sound designers who will create the game's sound effects and music. They will also ensure that the game's audio is synchronized with the gameplay.
5. Quality assurance: You will need a team of quality assurance testers who will test the game to identify and report any bugs or issues. They will also provide feedback on gameplay and suggest improvements.
6. User interface: You will need a team of user interface designers who will create the game's menus, HUD, and other graphical elements. They will ensure that the game's interface is intuitive and easy to use.
7. Marketing and distribution: You will need a team of marketers who will be responsible for promoting the game and creating a distribution plan. They will also work with publishers and distributors to ensure that the game reaches a wide audience.

These are just some of the main components that you will need to task out to your team when creating a game like Star Wars Battlefront 3. Depending on the scope and complexity of your game, you may require additional specialized roles such as AI programming, network programming, and level design.

To create a game like Star Wars Battlefront 3, you will need to design several core game mechanics that will form the basis of the gameplay. Here are some specific game mechanics you should consider:

1. Shooting mechanics: As a first-person shooter, Battlefront 3's shooting mechanics will be critical to the gameplay. This includes elements such as weapon handling, accuracy, and recoil.
2. Movement mechanics: Movement mechanics, such as sprinting, jumping, and sliding, will also be essential to the game. This will allow players to move around the map, avoid enemy fire, and engage in combat.
3. Class system: Battlefront 3 features a class system that allows players to choose between different classes of soldiers, each with its unique set of weapons and abilities. Your game should have a similar system to allow players to specialize and choose the playstyle that suits them best.
4. Vehicle mechanics: The game features various vehicles, such as speeder bikes, walkers, and starfighters. You will need to create a similar set of vehicles and design mechanics to control them, such as handling, speed, and weapons.
5. Objective-based gameplay: Battlefront 3 features a variety of objective-based game modes, such as capture the flag, domination, and extraction. Your game should have similar game modes that encourage teamwork and strategy.
6. Skill progression: To keep players engaged, your game should have a system for players to earn experience points and level up. This could unlock new weapons, abilities, and cosmetic items, giving players a sense of progression and reward.
7. AI behavior: The game features AI-controlled enemies and allies, which add depth and challenge to the gameplay. You will need to design AI behaviors that are challenging, but not frustratingly difficult, for players to fight against.

These are just a few examples of the specific game mechanics you will need to consider when creating a game like Star Wars Battlefront 3. It's essential to have a clear idea of the mechanics you want to include and design them in a way that is intuitive and engaging for the players.
